caption.p: Top 10 differential DNA repair genes for thyroid tumor comparisons.

tr.th: Gene product function according to GeneCards database [ 62]

tr.td: Cell cycle checkpoint protein, regulates mitotic translation by binding with translation initiation factors
Metabolizes small guanosine triphosphate (GTP) and thus regulates secretion, phagocytosis, cell polarization, motility, etc
Stimulates dissociation of GDP from RAS proteins
Insulin growth factor involved in growth and development
Transcription factor mediating interferon signaling by IFN-alpha and IFN-beta
Transcription factor that recognizes and binds to the enhancer heptamer motif 5′-TGA[CG]TCA-3′
Enhances the activity of DNA polymerase delta and takes part in replication fork repair and stabilization
Adhesion G Protein-Coupled Receptor B1 enhances the engulfment of apoptotic cells. Activates the Rho pathway in a G-protein-dependent manner
Preferentially activates MAPK8/JNK kinase, and functions as a positive regulator of JNK signaling pathway
Binds to TRAF2 and stimulates NF-kappaB activity

Serine/threonine kinase and DNA damage sensor, activating cell cycle checkpoint signaling upon DNA stress, phosphorylates and activates several proteins involved in the inhibition of DNA replication and mitosis; promotes DNA repair, recombination, and apoptosis.
Regulates mitosis by complexing with p34 to form the maturation-promoting factor necessary for proper control of the G2/M transition phase of the cell cycle.
Cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor which forms a stable complex with CDK4 or CDK6, and prevent their activation, thereby regulating cell cycle G1 phase progression.
Nuclear-localized E3 ubiquitin ligase which can promote carcinogenesis by targeting for proteasomal degradation tumor suppressor proteins including P53.
Phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase which catalyzes the first step in the biosynthesis of phosphatidylinositol 4-bisphosphate.
Variant histone that is phosphorylated as a reaction on DNA double-strand breaks, and replaces conventional H2A histone in nucleosomes

fn.p: Comparison of PC versus FC tissues.
Gene fold change (log base 2). Sign “-” means that the gene is not included in top-10 of the most up- or downregulated differential genes.
Comparison of FC + PC versus FA tissues.
Comparison of PC versus FA tissues.
